SENT.plain: A 70-year-old woman with no previous gastroesophageal surgery gave a 6-month history of dysphagia
Barium studies suggested a diagnosis of achalasia
Esophageal manometry showed absence of peristalsis and a high lower esophageal sphincter pressure
Endoscopy showed a dilated esophagus with food residue, and Barrett's esophagus was present
The association of Barrett's esophagus and achalasia must be rare
